reviewText: I love the voice of this young lady from Ireland...the scenery of this country is lovely but I prefer Chloe's performances in front of live audiences rather than just walking around Ireland.  To see her at her finest, watch the concerts of CELTIC WOMAN instead.

reviewText: This a very well done DVD. You not only have the wonderful voice of Chloe, but you get to see all the beauty of the Ireland country side. Every song that is on her CD "Walking in the Air" is here but in video form. With the combination of the music, Chloe's beauty voice and the beautiful Ireland country side this makes it is must have for any Celtic Woman or even if you are just starting to become one.

reviewText: Chloe is a wonderful talented singer/preformer holding up the tradition of the traditional music of the Irish Countryside.

reviewText: This young lady has a beautiful voice. I have the Celtic Women DVD's so I am very familiar with her work.The dvd was ok, but I didn't think it was dubbed awfully well,it was obviously a dvd that was made and the sound added afterwards and this was quite obvious.The scenery (the video was filmed in ireland) was absolutely beautiul, I think a little more thought could have gone into where quite a lot of it was filmed ( In a churchyard) but on the whole it was a lovely dvd to watch and her singing was as always lovely.She is a beautiul young lady with a voice of an angel and may her career sweep leaps and bounds.

reviewText: Chloe has an angelic voice and her music is beautiful. You can't do much better than her.
summary: Chloe is wonderful with a voice of an angel !!!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This DVD is a real treat for any Chloe fan. Chloe's singing is soft and dreamy, and her expressions and gestures natural. Her overal performance is unaffected and sincere. Filmed at various locations in Ireland, Chloe seems more Irish than I ever saw her in the sunlight, her cheeks rosy and her face shiny. Somehow she seems more Irish in these settings than in her studio photographs. The camera men could have been more imaginative, and some of Chloe's outfits looked too casual, however. I have Frank Patterson's Songs of Inspiration video, which was also filmed in Ireland, and I can't help comparing the filming of it with that of Walking in the Air. There's a lot to love anyway, though. I pop this in to watch a few songs almost every day, as it really inspires me. Great job Chloe!
